column8: This field serves as a unique identifier for each grant. It's important for every grant to have a distinct ID, making it a mandatory (1..1) field
Similar to the GrantID, this field serves as a unique identifier specific to the database. Just like the GrantID, it's crucial for data integrity, so it's also a mandatory (1..1) field

Each grant should have a title, but there might be cases where the original title is not available or relevant. Since it's a descriptive attribute, it's reasonable to make it mandatory (1..n) as titles should ideally be present, but there could be variations.

This field appears to be the English translation of the grant title, and it's also related to the grant type. However, English translations might not always be applicable, so it's better to consider this optional (0..1).
Similar to the GrantID and the unique database reference number, the grant number is essential for identification, making it mandatory (1..1).
Since grants can be associated with a specific region, this can be considered mandatory (1..1) as it helps categorize and locate grants effectively.
Similar to the grant region, the grant's country association is crucial, making it mandatory (1..1).
Similar to the region and country, the subregion can be considered mandatory (1..1) for accurate categorization.
The original grant amount is an important financial aspect, making it mandatory (1..1).
Currency is significant for interpreting grant amounts, but it might not always be applicable for certain grants. Therefore, it's better to make this optional (0..1).
This field might be applicable if the currency needs to be converted to USD, but it's not universally necessary. It's reasonable to make this optional (0..1).
Similar to the currency exchange rate, converted amounts might not apply to all grants. This can be optional (0..1).
Grant types might vary, and a grant can have multiple types. Hence, it's reasonable to consider this field as mandatory (1..n)
Abstracts provide a summary of the grant and might not always present. Therefore, it's better to make it optional (0..1).
Lay summaries might not be applicable to all grants, so they can be optional (0..1).
This attribute indicates whether ODA funding was used, but it might not always apply. It can be optional (0..1).
Start dates are important for grants but might not always be available or irrelevant if the year is not captured. It's reasonable to make this optional (0..1).
Similar to the start day, the start month can be optional (0..1)
Grant start year is important for periodical context of the grant, making it mandatory (1..1).
Similar to the start day, the end day can be optional (0..1).
Similar to the end day, the end month can be optional (0..1).
Grant end year is important for periodical context of the grant, making it mandatory (1..1).
The study subject can vary and a grant can be associated with multiple subjects, so it's reasonable to consider this optional (1..n).
Similar to the study subject, ethnicity can vary and can be optional (1..n).
Age groups can vary, and a grant can involve multiple age groups, so it's reasonable to consider this optional (1..n)
Rurality might not apply to all grants, so it can be optional (1..n).
Vulnerable populations might not apply to all grants, so it can be optional (1..n).
Similar to the vulnerable populations, occupational groups might not apply to all grants, so it can be optional (1..n).
Study types might vary, and a grant can have multiple types, so it's reasonable to consider this optional (1..n).
Clinical trial phases might not apply to all grants, so it can be optional (1..n).
